newsitem.title: FINLAND: FINNISH EMU PANEL TO BRIEF GOVT ON REPORT APRIL 23.
newsitem.headline: FINNISH EMU PANEL TO BRIEF GOVT ON REPORT APRIL 23.

text.p: A Finnish government-appointed panel of experts on European economic and monetary union (EMU) will brief the government about its conclusions on April 23, a government spokesman said on Wednesday.
"The chairman of the panel, (economics professor) Jukka Pekkarinen will give a verbal presentation to the government groups on April 23," he told Reuters by telephone.
The panel's final report, in writing, will published on May 6, he said.
The experts have been asked to examine the potential pros and cons of Finnish EMU membership and of remaining outside.
The government will give a report to parliament based on the expert panel's findings. Plenary debate on the government report is scheduled for May 20, he added.
